checkerboard
Class CheckerPlay

java.lang.Object
  online.search.commonRobot<checkerboard.CheckerBoard>
      checkerboard.CheckerPlay
All Implemented Interfaces:
CheckerConstants, java.lang.Runnable, UniversalConstants, Play2Constants, PlayConstants, RobotProtocol, SimpleRobotProtocol
public class CheckerPlay
extends commonRobot<checkerboard.CheckerBoard>
implements java.lang.Runnable, CheckerConstants, RobotProtocol

the Robot player only has to implement the basic methods to generate and evaluate moves. the actual search is handled by the search driver framework. in general, the Robot has it's own thread and operates on a copy of the board, so the main UI can continue unaffected by the processing of the robot.

Author:
ddyer

List_Of_Legal_Moves

public CommonMoveStack List_Of_Legal_Moves()
return an enumeration of moves to consider at this point. It doesn't have to be the complete list, but that is the usual procedure. Moves in this list will be evaluated and sorted, then used as fodder for the depth limited search pruned with alpha-beta.

Specified by:
List_Of_Legal_Moves in interface RobotProtocol

reScorePosition

public double reScorePosition(commonMove m,
                              int forplayer)
this re-evaluates the current position from the viewpoint of forplayer. for 2 player games this is to trivially negate the value, but for multiplayer games it requires considering multiple player's values.

Specified by:
reScorePosition in interface RobotProtocol
Overrides:
reScorePosition in class commonRobot<checkerboard.CheckerBoard>

StaticEval

public void StaticEval()
called as a robot debugging hack from the viewer. Print debugging information about the static analysis of the current position.

Specified by:
StaticEval in interface SimpleRobotProtocol

InitRobot

public void InitRobot(ViewerProtocol newParam,
                      ExtendedHashtable info,
                      BoardProtocol gboard,
                      java.lang.String evaluator,
                      int strategy)
prepare the robot, but don't start making moves. G is the game object, gboard is the real game board. The real board shouldn't be changed. Evaluator and Strategy are parameters from the applet that can be interpreted as desired.

Specified by:
InitRobot in interface SimpleRobotProtocol
Parameters:
newParam - TODO

InitBoardFromGame

public void InitBoardFromGame()
copy the game board, in preparation for a search

PrepareToMove

public void PrepareToMove(int playerIndex)
search for a move on behalf onf player p and report the result to the game. This is called in the robot process, so the normal game UI is not encumbered by the search.

Specified by:
PrepareToMove in class commonRobot<checkerboard.CheckerBoard>

doAlphaBetaFullMove

public commonMove doAlphaBetaFullMove()
breakpoint or otherwise override this method to intercept search events. This is a low level way of getting control in the middle of a search for debugging purposes.

Get_Random_Move

public commonMove Get_Random_Move(Random rand)
get a random move by selecting a random one from the full list. For games like hex, which have trivial move generators, this is "only" a factor of 2 or so improvement in the playout rate. For games with more complex move generators, it can by much more. Diagonal-Blocks sped up by 10x

Specified by:
Get_Random_Move in interface RobotProtocol
Overrides:
Get_Random_Move in class commonRobot<checkerboard.CheckerBoard>
Returns:
one of the moves or null as an error indication

simpleScore

public double simpleScore(int who)

NormalizedScore

public double NormalizedScore(commonMove lastMove)
for UCT search, return the normalized value of the game, with a penalty for longer games so we try to win in as few moves as possible. Values must be normalized to -1.0 to 1.0

Specified by:
NormalizedScore in interface RobotProtocol
Overrides:
NormalizedScore in class commonRobot<checkerboard.CheckerBoard>
